io.github.eb4j.util

Class ByteUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.eb4j.util.ByteUtil

  • public final class ByteUtil
extends java.lang.Object

    Utility class for byte operations.

      • asciiToJISX0208

        public static int asciiToJISX0208(int code)

        Convert to JIS X 0208 code from ASCII.

        Parameters:
        code - ASCII code (0x20〜0x7E).
        Returns:
        JIS X 0208 code.
        Throws:
        java.lang.AssertionError - if given code is outside from 0x20 to 0x7E.

      • jisx0201ToJISX0208

        public static int jisx0201ToJISX0208(int code)

        Convert JIS X 0201 chars into JIS X 0208 chars.

        Parameters:
        code - JIS X 0201 code (0xA0〜0xDF).
        Returns:
        JIS X 0208 code.
        Throws:
        java.lang.AssertionError - if given code is outside from 0xA0 to 0xDF.

      • deleteMark

        public static void deleteMark(byte[] b)

        Delete symbols character, such as ・‐’−, from the array. <p> After removal, it will pad '\0' in end of array. A size of the array returned is as same as original.

        Parameters:
        b - byte array in JIS X 0208 character set.

      • deleteSpaceLatin

        public static void deleteSpaceLatin(byte[] b)

        Delete space character from the array. <p> After removal, it will pad '\0' in end of array. A size of the array returned is as same as original.

        Parameters:
        b - byte array in ISO 8859-1 character set.

      • deleteSpace

        public static void deleteSpace(byte[] b)

        Delete full-width space character from the array. <p> After removal, array size will be shorten.

        Parameters:
        b - byte array in JIS X 0208 character set.

      • reverseWordLatin

        public static void reverseWordLatin(byte[] b)

        Returns a array in reverse order of the original array. <p> It recognize '\0' as a end of characters. It may return a array that length is shorter than original, when array includes '\0' character in middle of the array.

        Parameters:
        b - byte array in ISO 8859-1 character set.

      • reverseWord

        public static void reverseWord(byte[] b)

        Returns a array in reverse order of the original array. <p> It recognize '\0' as a end of characters. It may return a array that length is shorter than original, when array includes '\0' character in middle of the array.

        Parameters:
        b - byte array in JIS X 0208 character set.
